member.name: T:CPS.Utils
member.summary: Various utility functions, that can be usefull to user. All functions are static, so no need to create class.

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.HtmlSpecialChars(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes HTML/XML most important chars.

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_Term(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Escapes <, >, and & characters in given term for inclusion into XML (like search query). Also wraps the term in XML tags if xpath is specified. Note that this function does not escape @, $, " and other symbols, that are meaningfull in a search query. In you want to escape input that comes directly from user and that isn't supposed to contain any search operators at all, it's probably better to use function.

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_QueryTerm(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Escapes <, >, & characters as well as @"{}()=$~+[]* (search query operators) in the given term for inclusion into search query. Also wraps term in XML tags if xpath is specified.
member.param: String of operator symbols user is allowed to use.

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_QueryDictionary(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Converts given query dictionary to query string.
member.param: Query in Dictionary<string, Object> form, where dictionary key is xpath and value is string or Dictionary<string, Object>.

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_RelevanceOrdering(System.String)
member.summary: Generates ordering string for sorting by relevance for .

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_NumericOrdering(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates ordering string for numeric ordering for .

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_DateOrdering(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates ordering string for date ordering for .

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_StringOrdering(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates ordering string for string ordering for .
member.param: Tag's xpath by which to perform ordering.
Language (collation) used for ordering, for example 'en'.

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_GenericDistanceOrdering(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Generates ordering string for generic distance ordering for .

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_LatLongDistanceOrdering(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Generates ordering string for latitude/longitude (GPS) distance ordering for .
member.param: Dictionary with xpaths and coordinates for center point. Dictionary must contain exactly two elements, latitude first and longitude second.

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_PlaneDistanceOrdering(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Generates ordering string for plain distance ordering for .
member.param: Dictionary for xpaths and coordinates for center point.

member.name: M:CPS.Utils.CPS_FloatString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts string containing Windows float to string containing Unix float - fixes decimal seperator.

member.name: T:CPS.CPS_PRX_Operation
member.summary: The CPS_PRX_Operation class represents a particular operation for the partial-xreplace command. An operation consists of the xpath that identifies which nodes the operation should be performed on, the type of operation and new content that should be used in the operation.

member.summary: Constructs an instance of the CPS_PRX_Operation class.
member.param: XPath 1.0 expression denoting which nodes the operation should be performed on.
Type of the operation e.g. "append_children" or "remove".
Content of the operation - required for anything except the remove operation. Can be specified using , or .

member.summary: Gets documents from response, returned type depends on passed returnType parameter. If returnType is DOC_TYPE_SIMPLEXML, returns Dictionary<string, CPS_SimpleXML>. member.returns: Aggregate data as Dictionary<string, List<CPS_SimpleXML>> or Dictionary<string, List<XmlElement>>.

member.name: T:CPS.CPS_StaticRequest
member.summary: This class, which is derived from the CPS_Request class, can be used to send pre-formed XML requests to the storage. If you already have the XML request, you can send it to the API by using this class. Note that parameters from the CPS_Connection object such as storage name, username and password will not be used to form the request.

member.name: M:CPS.CPS_StaticRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an instance of the CPS_StaticRequest class.
member.param: Specifies which command is being sent. This is not mandatory for sending the request per se, but how the response will be parsed will depend on this setting, so if you want full response parsing from the API, you should specify the command here. Note that setting this parameter will not change the XML being sent to the database

member.name: M:CPS.CPS_Simple.search(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,CPS.CPS_Response.DOC_TYPE,System.String)
member.summary: Performs a search command. Returns the documents found in a Dictionary with document IDs as keys and document contents as values. Returned document type depends on returnType parameter. If returnType is DOC_TYPE_SIMPLEXML, returns Dictionary<string, CPS_SimpleXML>. If returnType is DOC_TYPE_ARRAY, returns null - not supported yet. If returnType is DOC_TYPE_STDCLASS, returns Dictionary<string, XmlElement>.
member.param: Query string. See for more info on best practices.
Number of documents to skip before including them in results.
Dictionary with tag xpaths as keys and list options (yes | no | snippet | highlight) as values.
Single ordering rule. You can use class function to generate this rule.
member.returns: Documents as Dictionary<string, CPS_SimpleXML> or Dictionary<string, XmlElement>.
